data.title: Leonardo da Vinci in Milan and the love story he painted • Velocipedi
data.meta_description: The most famous Renaissance love story in portraits painted by Leonardo Da Vinci in Milan. Will there be a happy end? Check our post!
data.text:
Renaissance Love story in Milan painted by Leonardo da Vinci

The beginning of this story is here

So, the young wife started to write complaints to her grandfather, the powerful king of Naples. And the grandfather threatened the duke of Milan with a war. The duke was forced to send away his beloved mistress and to become closer with his wife.

The mistress moved to a beautiful palace, the one were the Piccolo Teatro of Milan is situated now. Her palace became an art saloon of Milan, Leonardo da Vinci and many other famous art persons visited it.

Meanwhile the duke of Milan Ludovico Sforza started to be affascinate by his young wife. How young, humorous, beautiful and elegant she was! Everyone was in love with her. So the husband was!

The wife became his strength and support in the government of the state. And she gave a birth to they two kids. He finally had a heir.

Ludovico il Moro was still attracted by many ladies, but he did not have any serious relationship and the wife was closing her eyes on his love stories.

But one day…

Beatrice d’Este heard gossips that her husband fell in love with one of her court ladies… She thought it was one of many other stories, but she noticed her husband changed.

The First Lady of Milan, was pregnant the third time when Leonardo Da Vinci was painting the Last Supper in the family church of the Duke.

On the opposite wall of the refectory a fresco with crucifixion was painted by a court artist Montorfano.

By tradition the client who order the painting was represented in knees in front of the cross. So, Ludovico il Moro the duke and Beatrice d’Este his wife had to be painted there. But his portraits were ordered to the most important court artists Leonardo Da Vinci.

Leonardo da Vinci wanted them to pose. So once Beatrice came in the refectory of Santa Maria delle Grazie church to pose.

Catastrophe

She was 8 months pregnant and suddenly she felt vertigo. Leonardo went away to take some water. Beatrice remains alone in the room and saw an easel covered with a sheet. We all know women! Everyone would open a sheet even if she feels really bad!

And Beatrice surely did!

Immediately she fell unconscious.

There was a portrait of a young lady painted by Leonardo Da Vinci.

It was her! The court lady of Beatrice and she understood everything!

Leonardo Da Vinci was too prestigious and too expensive for a girl to order the portrait. The only person in Milan who could make Leonardo Da Vinci to paint this girl was the Duke, the husband.

So, it was true! He was really in love with this girl. Moreover, this girl was also pregnant, as Beatrice was.

Beatrice fell on her stomach. Couple of days later she and her baby died.
